Name: Sphinx
Description: This terracotta figurine represents a sphinx perched on a small base of which the front right hand side ends in an oval lamp. On his head, he wears a "nemes" surmounted by a "pschent" (double crown) and two lotus buds. His arms are crossed on the edge of the lamp and the tail winds itself around the right thigh. The piece underlines the bond between the sphinx and Harpocrates, confirmed by other terracotta figurines and by a coin of Alexander, showing the child god seated on a sphinx.
